website_summaries.verdict: Provides tips for boosting your score. Offers more difficult practice questions than other prep books.
pros: Book attempts to help you boost your score by focusing on the most difficult aspects of the ACT
Book doesn't contain a lot of unnecessary fluff, as it focuses on the most important areas
cons: Not really aimed at those looking to take the test for the first time or who need basic advice

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: Delivered as expected, and this book is great for anyone who wants to get better score on their ACT. Much better than regular ACT books.
customer_reviews.author: Tam Nguyen

customer_reviews.title: Not what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: Doesn’t really have any full length ACT tests, just a short book on what to focus on to get a 36, which wasn’t that helpful anyway. Wish thered be more practice problems.
customer_reviews.author: evan

customer_reviews.text: Not for teaching material. Best for those that have taken the ACT previously with a score of 30+. Helped raise my daughter's score from a 31 to 33.
customer_reviews.author: Nurse Jami

customer_reviews.title: It worked - got the 36!
customer_reviews.text: It worked. My son read this book and got his perfect 36 score. Worth the $20 for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Chrystal Tan

customer_reviews.title: the writing and science section were great
customer_reviews.text: I read the entire book but didn't get a 36:( however, I think the science section is great; to triage the question before reading so we can answer the easy one first. The practice questions in the reading section are too easy when compare to the actual exam. I did improve on the grammar section with this book
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Great Book
customer_reviews.text: Very good book! Great tips and practice problems with explanations. I slept on it the night before my test to hopefully absorb all the knowledge.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: Why not aim high?
customer_reviews.text: Barron's has always been one of my solid go-to options for text prep and this ACT book is no exception. I love that it perfectly summarizes ALL the most important stuff and coming in at a little over 300 pages isn't too daunting to tackle. My only complaint is if you're looking for actual practice exams, you're going to need another book - this one has practice questions throughout and then access to just 1 full length text online.
customer_reviews.author: Bradley Olin

customer_reviews.title: Barron's ACT 36 with Online Test: Aiming for the Perfect Score
customer_reviews.text: Barron's ACT 36 with Online Test: Aiming for the Perfect Score. This one is good to work on specific questions. Has one practice test included with this one. Will help to find your weak spots so you can work on them. Other books we have been using over the years has more than one test in them. I find this is not a stand alone test prep but great to use in addition with other books. Overall can't hurt and why not invest a bit in order to help boost that score since so much rides on it these days.
customer_reviews.author: 💜I Love Jellybeans

customer_reviews.title: Well organized, easy to understand
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is still probably about a year away from trying to take the ACT, but we got this to help her study and so we could kinda know what things she might need to focus on as she takes her courses that relate to the content of the ACT. Our state has scholarship benefits based on ACT score, and of course many colleges do as well. So we're trying to be diligent in making sure our kids are ready to try to do well on the exam. This book is a good resource at a good price. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Rileys

customer_reviews.title: Limited but good
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to get this and a SAT book, so I could have my daughter start working on practice questions BEFORE high school, so we could see where problem areas may be before they become last minute struggles! I love that there are practice questions and answers (for those that I cant remember!), BUT do wish there was more than just an online practice test. The SAT book I got has 3 practice tests,so she can get a feel of live testing. Overall, not a bad book, especially if you catch it on a sale price
customer_reviews.author: Bless Their Hearts Mom

customer_reviews.title: ACT Now And Buy This Test Aid..
customer_reviews.text: My son used this as part of his regiment for preparing for the ACT test. At the time of this writing he is a junior (11th grade). He has already taken the test and did quite well - but this was just a part of his preparation. Questions are peppered throughout this largish 300-page volume. I would have liked to see a series of prep tests included.
customer_reviews.author: Bromptonboy

customer_reviews.title: Excellent resource
customer_reviews.text: For the motivated student, this ACT 36 workbook is going to be great - helpful tips for the test and just enough of an overview with specific questions from each element of the exam to prepare you to score well - plus, they give you access to a full-length bonus online test, which is super helpful as well. Good resource for your student looking to prepare for the ACT.
customer_reviews.author: Dan Panetti

customer_reviews.title: Great study aid
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this book for my son to use while studying for the ACT. It is a good resource. He liked having the review questions on paper instead of looking at the computer screen. When it comes to this type of test, every little bit helps. He was able to break the sections up into manageable study sessions. After he finished the book copy he liked being able to access the online test. This book has current skills and I recommend this book.
customer_reviews.author: Etienne

customer_reviews.title: Helpful tool for the ACT
customer_reviews.text: This book will help your child prepare for the ACT. While it is limited on the number of practice tests it gives you (one), it offers lots of advice and will get you prepared to take the test. The ACT test is daunting and every little bit helps. This book should probably be combined with other study methods to help your child perform to the best of their ability.
customer_reviews.author: Bill G

customer_reviews.title: Not enought tests and didn't help much
customer_reviews.text: My son took a course and tests to see which might be a better test for him. He went through this before taking it and still didn't do well. He clearly is better suited for the SAT, however, I would think that if this was helpful, the disparity between the 2 wouldn't have been so great.
customer_reviews.author: Morley Dotes

customer_reviews.title: A must buy
customer_reviews.text: These Barron prep books are worth every penny and more! Great learning and prep tools for the test!
customer_reviews.author: IHeartAmazon

product_meta.title: ACT 36 with Online Test: Aiming for the Perfect Score (Barron's Test Prep)
